{"step_by_step_thinking": "Document [6] states that replacing saturated fats with unsaturated fats in the diet reduces the risk of cardiovascular diseases. Document [22] also supports this by stating that intake of trans-unsaturated fatty acids has adverse effects on blood lipids, which is a marker of cardiovascular risk. Therefore, the intake of unsaturated fatty acids is associated with a decreased risk of cardiovascular disease.", "answer_choice": "B. Decreased risk of cardiovascular disease"}
